trans-unit.source: Calculates the tangent of a number.

seg-source.mrk: Calculates the tangent of a number.

target.mrk: Calculates the tangent of a number.

trans-unit.source: Returns the trigonometric tangent of the number.

seg-source.mrk: Returns the trigonometric tangent of the number.

target.mrk: Returns the trigonometric tangent of the number.

trans-unit.source: Note that Tan() is "infinite" for ... -3PI/2, -PI/2, PI/2, 3PI/2, 5PI/2, ... and tends to return 1.63317787283838e+016 for such multiples of Pi-halves.

seg-source.mrk: -3PI/2, -PI/2, PI/2, 3PI/2, 5PI/2, ... and tends to return 1.63317787283838e+016 for such multiples of Pi-halves.

target.mrk: -3PI/2, -PI/2, PI/2, 3PI/2, 5PI/2, ... and tends to return 1.63317787283838e+016 for such multiples of Pi-halves.

trans-unit.source: Assign a Local constant variable the approximate PI number.

seg-source.mrk: Assign a Local constant variable the approximate PI number.

target.mrk: Assign a Local constant variable the approximate PI number.

trans-unit.source: Assign a Local variable the tangent of PI / 4.

seg-source.mrk: Assign a Local variable the tangent of PI / 4.

target.mrk: Assign a Local variable the tangent of PI / 4.

trans-unit.source: Assign a Local variable the formula to switch from radian to degree (equals to one degree in radian).

seg-source.mrk: Assign a Local variable the formula to switch from radian to degree (equals to one degree in radian).

target.mrk: Assign a Local variable the formula to switch from radian to degree (equals to one degree in radian).

trans-unit.source: Assign a Local variable the tangent of 90 degrees (firstly converted to radians).

seg-source.mrk: Assign a Local variable the tangent of 90 degrees (firstly converted to radians).

target.mrk: Assign a Local variable the tangent of 90 degrees (firstly converted to radians).
